12/1/24: Proposal on shareholder activism regarding human rights violations in Palestine for the ACSRI, annotated

Instead of taking consensus to mean a significant enough population on campus supports the aims of the proposal, the authors of the proposal argue that consensus lies in Columbia’s ethical values and commitment to socially responsible investing.

The authors emphasize that the proposal is about the use of shareholder rights to pressure companies. The authors assert that there is no significant opposition to exercising this shareholder right in relation to human rights violations in the campus community nor among alumni.

Referencing the consensus threshold directly, the authors claim that ACSRI has indicated that consensus does not mean “universal or near-universal agreement.”
